results.title: Evaluation of amlodipine, lisinopril, and a combination in the treatment of essential hypertension.
results.text_hl: Twenty four @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic blood pressure@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@DBP@@@) between 95 and 104 mm Hg received @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ 2.5 mg and 5 mg, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 5 mg and 10 mg, and their combination as per a prior randomisation schedule.

citations.NLM: Naidu MU, Usha PR, Rao TR, Shobha JC. Evaluation of amlodipine, lisinopril, and a combination in the treatment of essential hypertension. Postgrad Med J. 2000 Jun;76(896):350-3. PMID: 10824049
citations.BibTeX: @article{10824049, title={Evaluation of amlodipine, lisinopril, and a combination in the treatment of essential hypertension.}, author={Naidu MU and Usha PR and Rao TR and Shobha JC}, journal={Postgrad Med J}, volume={76}, number={896}, pages={350-3}}

results.title: The antihypertensive effect and safety of lisinopril in patients with mild to moderate essential hypertension. A Belgian multicenter study.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ monotherapy in the 1902 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ completing the trial resulted in marked reductions of systolic (SBP) and @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@DBP@@@ from 172.5/102.4 mm Hg at baseline to 147.4/86.6 mm Hg by week 8.

citations.NLM: Thomson M, Droussin AM, De Lame PA. The antihypertensive effect and safety of lisinopril in patients with mild to moderate essential hypertension. A Belgian multicenter study. Acta Cardiol. 1990;45(4):297-309. PMID: 2173313
citations.BibTeX: @article{2173313, title={The antihypertensive effect and safety of lisinopril in patients with mild to moderate essential hypertension. A Belgian multicenter study.}, author={Thomson M and Droussin AM and De Lame PA}, journal={Acta Cardiol}, volume={45}, number={4}, pages={297-309}}

results.title: Additive effects of diltiazem and lisinopril in the treatment of elderly patients with mild-to-moderate hypertension.
results.text_hl: The combinations of @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@ 240 mg + @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 10 mg and @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@ 120 mg + @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 10 mg showed increased efficacy in reducing @DISEASE_Isolated_Systolic_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000092244 @@@systolic@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic@@@ blood pressure compared to these drug doses used in monotherapy, but the effect of the combinations was less than predicted by an additive model.

citations.NLM: Chan P, Lin CN, Tomlinson B, Lin TH, Lee YS. Additive effects of diltiazem and lisinopril in the treatment of elderly patients with mild-to-moderate hypertension. Am J Hypertens. 1997 Jul;10(7 Pt 1):743-9. PMID: 9234828
citations.BibTeX: @article{9234828, title={Additive effects of diltiazem and lisinopril in the treatment of elderly patients with mild-to-moderate hypertension.}, author={Chan P and Lin CN and Tomlinson B and Lin TH and Lee YS}, journal={Am J Hypertens}, volume={10}, number={7 Pt 1}, pages={743-9}}

results.title: Lisinopril versus atenolol: decrease in systolic versus diastolic blood pressure with converting enzyme inhibition.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ reduced @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@SDBP@@@ to a similar extent.

citations.NLM: Pannier BE, Garabedian VG, Madonna O, Fouchard M, Darne B, Safar ME. Lisinopril versus atenolol: decrease in systolic versus diastolic blood pressure with converting enzyme inhibition. Cardiovasc Drugs Ther. 1991 Aug;5(4):775-81. PMID: 1653594
citations.BibTeX: @article{1653594, title={Lisinopril versus atenolol: decrease in systolic versus diastolic blood pressure with converting enzyme inhibition.}, author={Pannier BE and Garabedian VG and Madonna O and Fouchard M and Darne B and Safar ME}, journal={Cardiovasc Drugs Ther}, volume={5}, number={4}, pages={775-81}}

results.title: Advanced hypertensive heart disease in spontaneously hypertensive rats. Lisinopril-mediated regression of myocardial fibrosis.
results.text_hl: It has been shown in 14-week-old SHR with early @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive heart disease@@@ that @DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@myocardial fibrosis@@@ could be reversed and @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@myocardial diastolic stiffness@@@ normalized by 12-week treatment with the @GENE_ACE @GENE_24310 @@@angiotensin-converting enzyme@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Brilla CG, Matsubara L, Weber KT. Advanced hypertensive heart disease in spontaneously hypertensive rats. Lisinopril-mediated regression of myocardial fibrosis. Hypertension. 1996 Aug;28(2):269-75. PMID: 8707393
citations.BibTeX: @article{8707393, title={Advanced hypertensive heart disease in spontaneously hypertensive rats. Lisinopril-mediated regression of myocardial fibrosis.}, author={Brilla CG and Matsubara L and Weber KT}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={28}, number={2}, pages={269-75}}

results.title: [Evaluation of the safety and efficacy of the lisinopril + hydrochlorothiazide and captopril + hydrochlorothiazide combinations in the treatment of essential arterial hypertension].
results.text_hl: After this, @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with supine @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic blood pressure@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@SDBP@@@) greater than 90 mmHg were treated with the combinations @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@LIS@@@ 20 mg + @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@HCTZ@@@ 12.5 mg/o.d. or @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@CAP@@@ 50 mg + @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@HCTZ@@@ 25 mg/o.d. for 4 weeks; this dose was doubled if DBP was found to be greater than 90 mmHg after 2 weeks' combined therapy.

citations.NLM: Rappelli A, Ambrosio GB, Caiazza A, Labriola E, Maiorano G, Pretolani E, Porcellati C, Pupita F, Saba P, Stornello M. [Evaluation of the safety and efficacy of the lisinopril + hydrochlorothiazide and captopril + hydrochlorothiazide combinations in the treatment of essential arterial hypertension]. Minerva Med. 1992 Jan-Feb;83(1-2):57-64. PMID: 1312233

results.title: Effects of lisinopril and bisoprolol on lipoprotein metabolism in patients with mild-to-moderate essential hypertension.
results.text_hl: The reduction @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@in diastolic@@@ blood pressure was significantly (P < 0.05) greater in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ group than in the @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@bisoprolol@@@ group only at 6 months.

citations.NLM: Saku K, Liu K, Takeda Y, Jimi S, Arakawa K. Effects of lisinopril and bisoprolol on lipoprotein metabolism in patients with mild-to-moderate essential hypertension. Clin Ther. 1995 Nov-Dec;17(6):1136-46. PMID: 8750405

results.title: Glucose and lipid metabolism during long-term lisinopril therapy in hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ produced significant falls @DISEASE_Hairy_palms_and_soles @DISEASE_MESH:C535620 @@@in both@@@ systolic and @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic@@@ blood pressure @DISEASE_Hairy_palms_and_soles @DISEASE_MESH:C535620 @@@in both@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ groups during the long-term therapy.

citations.NLM: Shionoiri H, Ueda S, Gotoh E, Ito T, Ogihara T. Glucose and lipid metabolism during long-term lisinopril therapy in hypertensive patients. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1990 Dec;16(6):905-9. PMID: 1704982

results.title: [Cardiac structure-function relationship and the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system in hypertensive heart disease].
results.text_hl: In @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with genetic @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, established @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@left ventricular hypertrophy@@@, abnormal @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic stiffness@@@ due to interstitial @DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@, and reduced coronary vasodilator reserve associated with medial wall thickening of intramyocardial resistance vessels, the @GENE_ACE @GENE_24310 @@@ACE@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ was able to restore myocardial structure and function to normal.

citations.NLM: Funck RC, Wilke A, Rupp H, Maisch B, Brilla CG. [Cardiac structure-function relationship and the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system in hypertensive heart disease]. Herz. 1995 Oct;20(5):330-9. PMID: 7498880
citations.BibTeX: @article{7498880, title={[Cardiac structure-function relationship and the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system in hypertensive heart disease].}, author={Funck RC and Wilke A and Rupp H and Maisch B and Brilla CG}, journal={Herz}, volume={20}, number={5}, pages={330-9}}

results.title: The cardiac structure-function relationship and the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system in hypertension and heart failure.
results.text_hl: In @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with genetic @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, established @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@left ventricular hypertrophy@@@, abnormal @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic stiffness@@@ due to interstitial @DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@ and reduced coronary vasodilator reserve associated with medial wall thickening of intramyocardial resistance vessels, the @GENE_ACE @GENE_24310 @@@ACE@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ restored myocardial structure and function towards normal.

citations.NLM: Brilla CG. The cardiac structure-function relationship and the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system in hypertension and heart failure. Curr Opin Cardiol. 1994 Jul;9 Suppl 1():S2-10; discussion S10-1. PMID: 7827369
